revised_title: Infection of Wild Animals and the Transmission of Trypanosomiasis
tldr: The authors investigate the relationship between wild animals and trypanosomiasis, specifically focusing on the role of Glossina palpalis in transmitting Trypanosoma uniforme. They find that wild animals, such as waterbuck, bushbuck, and situtunga, are naturally infected with T. uniforme, and that G. palpalis may be the carrier of this species of trypanosome.
